about.summary: A suite of functions for conducting and interpreting analysis of statistical interaction in regression models that was formerly part of the 'jtools' package. Functionality includes visualization of two- and three-way interactions among continuous and/or categorical variables as well as calculation of "simple slopes" and Johnson-Neyman intervals (see e.g., Bauer & Curran, 2005 <doi:10.1207/s15327906mbr4003_5>). These capabilities are implemented for generalized linear models in addition to the standard linear regression context.

A suite of functions for conducting and interpreting analysis of statistical interaction in regression models that was formerly part of the 'jtools' package. Functionality includes visualization of two- and three-way interactions among continuous and/or categorical variables as well as calculation of "simple slopes" and Johnson-Neyman intervals (see e.g., Bauer & Curran, 2005 <doi:10.1207/s15327906mbr4003_5>). These capabilities are implemented for generalized linear models in addition to the standard linear regression context.

name: r-interactions
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.2.0" %}

{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-interactions
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/interactions_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/interactions/interactions_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 3ec9b3778656f930d60fab99dff0a7ab4cf784da818e6d05d25df026fb588bc8

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip  # [win]

  host:
    - r-base
    - r-cli
    - r-generics
    - r-ggplot2 >=3.4.0
    - r-jtools >=2.0.3
    - r-rlang >=0.3.0
    - r-tibble
    - r-broom

  run:
    - r-base
    - r-cli
    - r-generics
    - r-ggplot2 >=3.4.0
    - r-jtools >=2.0.3
    - r-rlang >=0.3.0
    - r-tibble
    - r-broom

test:
  commands:
    # You can put additional test commands to be run here.
    - $R -e "library('interactions')"  # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('interactions')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://interactions.jacob-long.com
  dev_url: https://github.com/jacob-long/interactions
  license: MIT
  summary: A suite of functions for conducting and interpreting analysis of statistical interaction in regression models that was formerly part of the 'jtools' package. Functionality includes visualization of two- and three-way interactions among continuous and/or categorical variables as well as calculation of "simple slopes"
    and Johnson-Neyman intervals (see e.g., Bauer & Curran, 2005 <doi:10.1207/s15327906mbr4003_5>). These capabilities are implemented for generalized linear models in addition to the standard linear regression context.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT'
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - thewchan

Functionality includes visualization of two- and three-way interactions among continuous and/or categorical variables as well as calculation of "simple slopes" and Johnson-Neyman intervals (see e.g., Bauer & Curran, 2005 <doi:10.1207/s15327906mbr4003_5>). These capabilities are implemented for generalized linear models in addition to the standard linear regression context.
